{"step_by_step_thinking": "Multiple documents mention that there is an increased risk of meningiomas in survivors of childhood leukemia. For instance, Document [0] states that cranially irradiated survivors are predisposed to the development of CNS tumors, including meningiomas. Document [1] also mentions that childhood cancer survivors who have undergone cranial irradiation have an increased risk of acquiring radiation-induced meningioma. Document [2] further supports this by stating that meningioma is the most common subsequent neoplasm following cranial irradiation among survivors of childhood cancer. Therefore, the answer is yes, there is an increased risk for meningiomas in childhood leukemia survivors.", "answer_choice": "A"}
